com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.metadata

Class TableSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.metadata.TableSchema
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<ColumnSchema>

    public class TableSchema
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<ColumnSchema>
    The TableSchema class provides a representation of a data table's schema, which provides information about the data table and its columns. A schema defines the structure of the data table, but nothing about its actual contents (including how many rows it contains).

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableSchema

        public TableSchema(java.lang.String tableName)
        Constructor for an empty data table. The resulting schema will not contain any columns.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name for the data table.

      • TableSchema

        public TableSchema(java.lang.String tableName,
           java.lang.String[] columnLabels,
           DataType[] types)
        Constructor specifying the table name, and column names and data types. The equivalent entry locations in the column label and data type arrays identify a single column (so the arrays must be of equal size).
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name for the data table.
        columnLabels - The names for the columns.
        types - The data types for the columns.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if the sizes of columnLabels and types are not equal.

    • Method Detail

      • setPrimaryKeyColumn

        public void setPrimaryKeyColumn(java.lang.String primaryKeyColumn)
        Set the column to use as the primary key column for the data table.
        Parameters:
        primaryKeyColumn - The name of the primary key column.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if primaryKeyColumn is not a column in this schema.

      • getPrimaryKeyColumn

        public java.lang.String getPrimaryKeyColumn()
        Get the name of the primary key column specified in this schema. If a primary key has not been specified, then this method will return null.
        Returns:
        the primary key column's name.

        public java.lang.String getTableLabel()

        Returns:

      • getColumnLabel

        public java.lang.String getColumnLabel(int columnIndex)
        Get the name of a column at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The (0-based) column position.
        Returns:
        the name of the column at columnIndex.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if columnIndex is less than zero or greater than/equal to the number of columns held by this schema.

      • getColumnIndex

        public int getColumnIndex(java.lang.String columnLabel)
        Get the position of the specified column.
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The name of the column in question.
        Returns:
        the (0-based) index of the position of column columnLabel.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if columnLabel is not a column in this schema.

      • getColumnSchemas

        public ColumnSchema[] getColumnSchemas()
        Get the schemas, in order, for the columns in this schema.
        Returns:
        this schema's column schemas.

      • getColumnLabels

        public java.lang.String[] getColumnLabels()
        Get the labels, in order, for the columns in this schema.
        Returns:
        this schema's column names.

      • getColumnTypes

        public DataType[] getColumnTypes()
        Get the data types, in order, for the columns in this schema.
        Returns:
        the data types held by this schema's columns.

      • hasColumn

        public boolean hasColumn(java.lang.String columnLabel)
        Determine if a specified column exists in this schema or not.
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The name of the column in question.
        Returns:
        true if a column named columnLabel exists in this schema, false if not.

      • addColumn

        public boolean addColumn(java.lang.String columnLabel,
                DataType type)
        Add a column to this schema. the column will be appended to the end of the already existing columns.
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The column label.
        type - The data type held by the column.
        Returns:
        true if the column was added successfully.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if a column with name columnLabel already exists.

      • dropColumn

        public boolean dropColumn(java.lang.String columnLabel)
        Drop a column from the schema.
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The name of the column to drop.
        Returns:
        true if the column was removed successfully.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if a column with name columnLabel does not exist.

      • getColumnSchema

        protected ColumnSchema getColumnSchema(java.lang.String columnLabel,
                           DataType type)
        Construct a new column schema using the specified information. This method is used to build the column schemas held by this schema when it is constructed, or when a new column is added.
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The column label.
        type - The data type held by the column.
        Returns:
        a column schema for a column named columnLabel and holding types.

      • setColumnLabels

        protected void setColumnLabels()
        Set the labels for the columns held by this schema. This method rebuilds the internal column name list so that it is consistent with the column schemas held by this class. This method is intended for use by extending schemas which may need to modify the column schemas directly.

      • setColumnLabels

        protected void setColumnLabels(java.lang.String[] columnLabels)
        Set the labels for the columns held by this schema. This method is intended for use by extending schemas which may need to specify this array directly. No checks are made to ensure that the array is consistent with this schema, so care must be taken when using this method to avoid invalid schema states.
        Parameters:
        columnLabels - The column names, in order.

      • setColumnTypes

        protected void setColumnTypes()
        Set the column types held by this schema. This method rebuilds the internal column types list so that it is consistent with the column schemas held by this class. This method is intended for use by extending schemas which may need to modify the column schemas directly.

      • setColumnTypes

        protected void setColumnTypes(DataType[] columnTypes)
        Set the column types held by this schema. This method is intended for use by extending schemas which may need to specify this array directly. No checks are made to ensure that the array is consistent with this schema, so care must be taken when using this method to avoid invalid schema states.
        Parameters:
        columnTypes - The column types, in order.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<ColumnSchema> iterator()
        Get an iterator over the columns held by this schema, in the ordered they are specified.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<ColumnSchema>
        Returns:
        an iterator over this schema's column schemas.

        Copy this schema to a new one with a different data table name.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a copy of this schema, using tableLabel for the data table name.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • blindlyEquals

        protected boolean blindlyEquals(java.lang.Object o)
        Determine if this object is equal to another. This method is intended to allow class inheritance without breaking the equals(Object) contract. Specifically, when extending this class and adding (significant) internal additions, this method should be overridden (equals(Object) cannot be overridden as it is declared final). The idiom for overriding this method in an extending class Extension is as follows: 
             protected boolean blindlyEquals(Object o) {
         if (o == this)
             return true;
         if (!(o instanceof Extension))
             return false;
         if (!super.blindlyEquals(o))
             return false;
         ...//(equals checks specific to Extension)
     }
        Parameters:
        o - The object to compare.
        Returns:
        true if o is equal to this object, false if not.

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
